subject: Re: [junit] Re: Conditional tearDown()

messageBody:
On Fri, 3 Jan 2003, Brian <br524@...> wrote:

> I only have one test in the TestCase, and if it fails, I want to leave
> the database in the state it was in when the test failed so I can
> inspect what happened.

Why don't you make tearDown() do a commit on the current connection, and
make your test do a rollback at the end. If the test passes, the rollback
will be executed before the commit, and the commit will do nothing. If the
test fails, fails, an exception will be thrown, the rollback will not be
executed, and the commit will commit the changes your test made.

Of course, this presupposes that you're keeping the connection you're
using as a field in the TestCase object, which has always made me a bit
nervous, since I've never seen a guarantee that there will never be more
than one thread active in a TestCase. Or is there such a guarantee, and I've
just missed it?
